com.ep.ggs.system.updater

Interface Updatable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Server

    public interface Updatable
    An updatable object can be automatically updated by the core. You must provide the following:

    A info URL This url will return, in json, all updates that this object contains.
    An example can be found below:
    {"updates":
    [{"uid":"1","version":"1.1.0","download_url":"http:\/\/www.mywebsite.com\/downloads\/update","minimum_core_version":"1.0.0b7"},
    {"uid":"2","version":"1.2.0","download_url":"http:\/\/www.mywebsite.com\/downloads\/update","minimum_core_version":"1.0.0b8"}]}
    A Download URL This url will return a jar file of the latest version.
    Update Type This is the how the object will update, see UpdateType for more info.
    Current Version This will return, in a String, the current version of this object.
    Unload Method This will unload the object from memory. For plugins, PluginHandler#unload(Plugin) will do the trick. For commands, CommandHandler#removeCommand(Command) will unload the object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getCurrentVersion()
      Get the current version of this object
      String getDownloadPath()
      The path this object will be updated and loaded again
      String getInfoURL()
      The URL that contains the json information about all updates for this object.
      String getName()
      The name of this updatable object.
      UpdateType getUpdateType()
      The type this object will do.
      String getWebsite()
      The website to go to for manual updates.
      void unload()
      This method will unload the object before it gets updated.

    • Method Detail

      • getInfoURL

        String getInfoURL()
        The URL that contains the json information about all updates for this object.
        Example URL:
        return "http://www.mcforge.net/curversion.txt";
        Example Content:
        {"updates":
        [{"uid":"1","version":"1.1.0","download_url":"http:\/\/www.mywebsite.com\/downloads\/update","minimum_core_version":"1.0.0b7"},
        {"uid":"2","version":"1.2.0","download_url":"http:\/\/www.mywebsite.com\/downloads\/update","minimum_core_version":"1.0.0b8"}]}
        Returns:
        The URL.

      • getWebsite

        String getWebsite()
        The website to go to for manual updates.
        Returns:
        The website URL

      • getUpdateType

        UpdateType getUpdateType()
        The type this object will do. These can be found in UpdateType If the default update type set by the user is higher, then that will be used instead. Example: UpdateType.Auto_Silent is less than UpdateType.Auto_Notify
        Returns:
        The type of update.

      • getCurrentVersion

        String getCurrentVersion()
        Get the current version of this object
        Returns:
        The current version.

      • getDownloadPath

        String getDownloadPath()
        The path this object will be updated and loaded again
        Returns:
        The path. Example: return "plugins/Test.jar";

      • getName

        String getName()
        The name of this updatable object. This can return Plugin#getName() or just return a normal string
        Returns:
        The updatable object name.

      • unload

        void unload()
        This method will unload the object before it gets updated. For plugins, you would call the PluginHandler#unload(Plugin) method.
